definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: I don't want to lose my health for the sake of filthy lucre.
sentences.chinese: 我不想为了几个臭钱而损伤身体。

sentences.english: I don't want to touch any of your filthy lucre.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿意碰你的那些臭钱。

sentences.english: Give him the few lousy bucks! Your life is more precious.
sentences.chinese: 把你的几个臭钱给他，命比钱更重要。

sentences.english: All your money won't stop me.
sentences.chinese: 你的臭钱，那是不能让我裹足不前的。

sentences.english: He may get the devil and all the money.
sentences.chinese: 他可以把这笔臭钱全部拿走。

sentences.english: I don't want your stinking money.
Husband:I don't know why you do with your brass.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道你老存着那些臭钱干什么。

definition: (Wu dialect) bum/wretched-looking tramp who lives by begging or stealing
to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
dog's leg/fig. one who follows a villain/henchman/hired thug
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to work against the interests of sb one derives support from/to double-cross one's employer/to bite the hand that feeds you
see 嗤之以鼻[chi1 zhi1 yi3 bi2]
